title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: W. Storer How to Orlando Brown, February 3, 1866
summary: How's letter endorses Frederick Tukey's decision in the E.P. Walton case (although said decision is not disclosed in this letter). He also asserts that he needs a detachment of at least 30 men stationed in Staunton for that area of the sub-district to be able to function properly.
keywords: Legal System, Military Authority, Administration/Bureaucracy, American Civil War
